creditline: The Suzanne S. Roberts Fund for Asian Art
inscription:
落日幽巌下　寒泉木葉沈　澄然明似鑑　照見古人心

Poem: Seisho sanbō shū no. 164
markings: poem UL red seal: 无心 {mushin} [mushin #2]; poem LL red seals: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #4]; 静處 {seisho} [seisho #4]; LRC, in red: 拙居 {sekkyo}
medium: Hanging scroll, ink and color on silk
signed: 戊午清和月古道人 {tsuchinoe-uma seiwazuki Kodōjin} (April 1918, Kodōjin)
text:
落日幽巌下　
寒泉木葉沈　
澄然明似鑑　
照見古人心
Setting sun beneath a hidden cliff;
Cold spring, where leaves are sinking.
Crystalline, as clear as a mirror;
Here are reflected the hearts of the ancients.
title: Landscape with Autumn Scenery
